name: Spicy Curtido (Pickled Cabbage Slaw)
description: Curtido is a lightly pickled cabbage slaw common in Central America.  Using a half jalapeno gives it some real zip but you can always dial back on it if you want.  (Note:  these instructions are not meant for long term canning.)

recipeInstructions.text: Thinly slice the 1/2 head of cabbage, 1/2 onion and 1/2 jalapeno.  Grate the carrot.
recipeInstructions.name: Thinly slice the 1/2 head of cabbage, 1/2 onion and 1/2 jalapeno.  Grate the carrot.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl:  1 cup vinegar, 1.5 cups water, 1 teaspoon Mexican oregano, freshly cracked black pepper, 2 teaspoons salt (Kosher or sea salt).
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the remaining ingredients in a bowl:  1 cup vinegar, 1.5 cups water, 1 teaspoon Mexican oregano, freshly cracked black pepper, 2 teaspoons salt (Kosher or sea salt).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the liquid mixture to the veggies and combine well.  Crush the cabbage a bit so that it will fit into the jars.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the liquid mixture to the veggies and combine well.  Crush the cabbage a bit so that it will fit into the jars.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill two pint-sized Mason jars with the veggies and top with the brine.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill two pint-sized Mason jars with the veggies and top with the brine.

recipeInstructions.text: Seal well and let pickle overnight in the fridge.
recipeInstructions.name: Seal well and let pickle overnight in the fridge.
